editorial_summary.overview: Elegant stop for afternoon tea, cocktails, sweets & savouries based on Roald Dahl's classic story.

result.name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Afternoon Tea

html_attributions: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Afternoon Tea
Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Afternoon Tea

reviews.text:
The afternoon tea here was nice.
The teas were very nice with a variety.
The food was ok, sandwiches were tasty.

There was no chocolate as I would expect. A small melted pot to dip some marshmallows in, would possibly be an idea but there was no chocolate sadly.

The atmosphere was not entertaining at all and very disappointing. You would expect to have an aroma of something that would relate to the book/movie but there was nothing. The decor had no relation to the Charlie chocolate theme and overall I do not agree it should be called this if there is nothing in relation to it. For Â£70 per person, we expected a better atmosphere in relation to the theme.

However the staff were amazing. Catered for our difficult needs of allergies and vegetarian options. Very friendly and attentive.

Would not return unless they made it more like the theme of a chocolate factory. But overall an ok experience.

I cannot explain how wonderful our experience was here! I have a gluten and dairy allergy. They were one of only 3 places I found in London that could accommodate both allergies. They made sure I had everything my family had and I wasnâ€™t shorted anything. The service was incredible. The foodâ€¦.was incredible! We went to the Max Hatter tea the day before and it was awful for me. No scones, no substitutes. They gave me a vegan menu instead of just dairy free. None of these mixups happened here. I got to try my first scone and it was DELICIOUS! The pineapple spread that comes with the scones is out of this world. Try it even if you donâ€™t think you like pineapples. It was one of the favorite things I had there ðŸ˜… Everything was honestly out of this world. I donâ€™t even care for salmon either and the salmon was incredible. They offered us seconds as well before they brought out the next course. They kept the tea flowing. I had a different idea of what weâ€™d experience based on pictures (I thought weâ€™d have really crazy drinks and food with like smoking hot chocolate etc) but this was still an absolute delight. I am so grateful that my dietary needs were able to be accommodated with no issues or mix ups and I got exactly the same amount of food and type of food as everyone else. Highly recommend!!

Great place to go if you're gluten free; really tasty sandwiches, scones (that actually taste like scones and have the right texture!) and beautiful desserts. All the staff were so helpful and friendly; I was given a gf chocolate cake for my birthday and they put lots of scones in a box for me to take away without me even asking!

I went in June with my daughter, sister, niece and nephew and had an amazing time. The displays, the food and drinks were wonderful.  I then came back in August with 2 friends and not only was it the exact same experience but they remembered when I came and where I sat. I will definitely go back when I visit London again

We went here for the Gluten Free tea experience. Pio our server was very nice and helpful and made sure our daughter had a wonderful gluten free birthday experience. The maitre'd was also very generous and ensured we had a wonderful time.

My only slight criticism is that if you are expecting whimsy and fun related to Charlie & the Chocolate Factory it really only comes through in the food. The decor and ambiance is classy, which is nice but a bit different from what we expected.

Would definitely recommend the whole experience especially for those who are gluten free.
